alert.note: Alert for Pepin; Pierce; St. Croix (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued August 20 at 9:48PM CDT until August 24 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 110 possible. * WHERE...All counties in the Twin Cities metro area plus Wright, McLeod, Rice, and Goodhue counties in Minnesota and St. Croix, Pierce, and Pepin counties in Wisconsin. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heat should start waning by Thursday, but the cumulative effect from multiple days of excessive heat may lower one`s tolerance to handle it. The extreme heat may also lead to buckling roads.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
